title: Lisa Campaign Brief
description: Schema for defining campaign deliverables across marketing, PR, and branding disciplines

campaignType.description: The discipline for this campaign. Determines which agent prompt and quality gates are applied.

description.description: Brief description of the campaign goals and context
examples: Launch campaign for new AI-powered analytics dashboard

deliverables.description: Array of deliverables to create for this campaign

type.description: Type of deliverable. Marketing types: email-sequence, landing-page-copy, social-posts, ad-copy, blog-article, newsletter, case-study, webinar-script. PR types: press-release, media-pitch, press-kit, crisis-communication, talking-points, media-advisory, op-ed, qa-document, fact-sheet. Branding types: brand-guidelines, brand-positioning, voice-tone-guide, messaging-framework, tagline, brand-story.

title.description: Short, descriptive title for this deliverable

description.description: Detailed description of what needs to be created and why
examples: 3-email nurture sequence for trial signups with progressive value proposition
Press release announcing new product features for tech media outlets
Brand positioning statement defining our unique value in the market

acceptanceCriteria.description: Specific, verifiable criteria that must be met for this deliverable to be approved. Must be testable (not vague like 'good quality'). Examples: 'Includes 3 emails', 'Readability score > 60', 'Passes brand compliance check', 'Word count: 800-1000'.

priority.description: Priority level (1 = highest priority, processed first). Use to control execution order and handle dependencies.

approved.description: Whether this deliverable has been completed and approved. Lisa sets this to true when all acceptance criteria are met. Start with false for all deliverables.

targetKeyword.description: Optional: Target keyword for SEO optimization (used by seo-check.py for marketing deliverables). Set to null if not applicable.

dependencies.description: Optional: Array of deliverable IDs that must be completed before this one. Ensure dependencies have lower priority numbers.

notes.description: Optional: Additional notes, context, or instructions for creating this deliverable
examples: Coordinate with PR team on timing

examples.description: Launch campaign for new AI-powered analytics dashboard
